subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Graduate of Linguistics and Communication Studies. Expert Practitioner
subject.description:
My first student came to me because he heard me speaking in the corridor at my workplace. He wasn't sure what he needed but he surely knew he wanted to improve his German. He wanted to be able to speak up in class and also excel in his studies when he finally moves abroad. 

I learnt how to speak German in Germany. I understand that it is harder if you are outside of the country and of course everyday life circumstances comes in between.

I would like to bridge that gap for you. If you are already experienced with the German Language we will only speak German. If you are a fresher I am glad to switch in between. Whatever works best for you to become better in the Language.

I enjoy conversing. Talking about your everyday life and why you are learning German because at the end of the day all this is necessary to describe your experiences to others speaking the language.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Learn how to speak fluent Yoruba from an expert educator
subject.description:
Ede yoruba se pataki, o se koko (Yoruba is very important), opolopo eniyan ni o feran lati maa so ede yoruba (so many people really want to speak Yoruba), sugbon ti wo ko gbo ede yii daradara (but they don't understand the language). 

Fun apeere bi (for example), ikinni ni ede yoruba (Greetings in Yoruba). E kaaro sa/ma, (Good morning sir/ma), alifabeeti ede yoruba (Yoruba Alphabet) a, b, d (A, B, D, There's no letter C, Q, V, X, Z in Yoruba), iseda oro ede yoruba (Yoruba word formation) gbolohun kekeke ede yoruba (Simple yoruba sentences) ibeere ati idahun ni ede yoruba (Question and answers in Yoruba Language), Oonka ede yoruba (Numbers in Yoruba), Oro ati idakeji (Words and Opposite), ati bebelo(etc.) 

O dara lati le so ede Yoruba (It's good to know how to speak Yoruba), O si rorun pupo lati gbo, ko si ni ra, rara. (It's easy to learn). E se pupopupo. (Thank you so much). Emi ni iyaaafin T.A Fadiji. (I am Mrs. T.A. Fadiji).

The best teacher in yoruba for the past ten years, and have trained. 

PS: I hope you were able to make out the sentences correctly. If you had a hard time, don't worry. After our first few lessons, you'll be able to speak and understand Yoruba. Thank you.

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: I love teaching maths and simplifying hard questions for my students
subject.description:
Mathematics is the science of numbers; it deals with the logic of shape, quantity, and arrangement. Further maths is a step further into math with several advanced courses. For example, general math has courses like A.P and G.P( in series and sequences) but further math goes ahead to treat convergence problems.

In times past, I have taught students in both junior and senior secondary classes who have struggled with understanding mathematics and they have gone on to write their JSSCE, WAEC and/or NECO and have passed.

My style of teaching includes establishing foundation topics in math before going further to further math questions or problems.

I encourage every student to read through his/her notes and the topic to be discussed before each class, come to class with writing materials and a calculator, turn off every distraction including phones and participate in class well as show respect for the class.

A well lighted and airy space, table(s) and chair(s), and a whiteboard maker will help make the class comfortable and condusive for learning.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Making your ward mathematically smart: JUST REACH OUT NOW!!!!!
subject.description:
I am an experienced teacher of mathematics and have been grooming students to love/appreciate numbers, making them learn maths and other numeric skills passionately. I teach by first of all making students to understand that mathematics is the simplest subject because it deals with facts and has a pattern, which could be logic oriented, formula or our common day to day examples of numbers, items and countable transactions. With this, they are always relaxed and secondly I understand the problem areas in the subject so I know the exact weak areas children face and I hit it squarely by throwing questions in those areas, giving assignments and responding to that by a way of assessment.

In fact, NewHall Internaational School Chevron, Lekki, where I teach, organizes after class periods for some average pupils, my participation in that class has been having a positive multiplier effect as my pupils/students record tremendous improvements which far outweighs past numeric abilities.

Finally, I teach by connecting the known with what is not yet known to the students, this enables them to understand better any explanation. Also as a Montessori/IGCSE trained teacher I adopt numerous teaching methods that befits different learning categories. This has been giving me the desired results expected.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: If what you need is a Fix-It-Tutor, then You need not look any further
subject.description:
Dear Client,

Thank you for visiting my profile. Here are a few reasons why I'm the best available hand for your ward:

1. General Mathematics teaches more than mere calculations, but equally, help students to develop analytical minds. If this is not gotten right at this level, a not so smart adult may result. Hence, it is important that an experienced and patient Tutor who will deploy an illustrative mode of teaching, to ensure that it is not only understood but enjoyed by the student. Having taught this for at least 3years at basic school level(primary and secondary), I believe I'm more than qualify to deliver.

2. Not only have I taught for 3years, but I have also been able to achieve impressive results with my students. One of such is the Mosunmola who moved from hating Mathematics to loving it, and eventually had an A in Junior WAEC, after her parents had given up on her poor run of form in the subject.

3. My relationship with my students goes beyond a pen and notepad. I do ensure that I become their friends, this makes me approachable, so they can easily inquire of me when they are having difficulty understanding what they are being taught. I deploy illustrative analogies to aid the learning process of my pupils and make the atmosphere less tense and friendly.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Maths has methods, formulars & constants, you will understand them well
subject.description:
I teach Mathematics well with passion. I will help you take control of the subject and you will fall in love with Mathematics, you can be sure of excellence in your grade. I had A1 in my WAEC in distinctions in other exams after that level.

Major challenges are usually solving word problems, that we will tackle to the roots. You will also understand methods of graphs, statistics and constructions as it relates to maths.

Finally, solving quadratic equations and trigonometry will be much easy and approachable for you. Mathematics is easy once you are ready... I am ready to teach you.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Maths has methods, formulars & constants, you will understand them well
subject.description:
I have over 6 years professional experience teaching students in lower and upper primary classes, as well as junior and senior secondary classes. I use modern teaching aids and techniques when tutoring my students, and also relate each concept to their daily experiences so they can understand and retain the knowledge better.

I teach the major subjects for Years 1-6 such as English Language, Quantitatives, Mathematics, Creative & Letter Writing, Verbal Reasoning, ICT etc., as well as coach students in preparation for Common Entrance and secondary school exams, and have recorded great successes. In teaching young learners, I try to understand how best they learn and then tailor the lessons to suit them, while making emphasis on areas they may not have thoroughly understood.

I am passionate about teaching. I strive to help my students master their numeracy, reasoning and vocabulary, including written and spoken English which are very important parts of training a pupil/student into a creative, analytical and responsible adult capable of self-sustained continuous learning. That's my joy as a teacher currently teaching at Lagoons.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Sound Elementary Maths Teacher
subject.description:
1. I started my teaching career in 2011, with the sole motive to build capacity and enrich lives. I've taught over 50 students individually and 300 as group. My second class upper background in Actuarial Science has proffered me the relevant skills to handle Elementary Mathematics effective across nursery and primary classes.

2. I take my time to understand the strengths and weaknesses of my students and strategically formulate means to tackle them. I'm a distinction student and I can handle all levels of students. I have over the years built capacities and transformed students individually and helped to reach their goals.

3. I like to teach in a serene environment that allows easy flow of information. I'm a proficient data analyst and computer literate. I have over the years adapt myself with recent technological trend in both local and international examinations. I give all my lectures off hand as a demonstration of strength to my students which has over the years made them better with the thought of emulating such.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.name: Primary Mathematics
subject.headline: Mathematics has always been my favourite subject.
subject.description:
The only time I never had a distinction in Mathematics was during my first term in SSS1. That was because I joined the school during the 4th week, but then I still had the highest score. While in Primary school, I discovered a procedure for determining multiples of any number between 1 and 10, except 7 (which I had to read about years later). I was already reading Engineering Mathematics by K A Stroud while in JSS3.
I taught an Ireland-based Nigerian girl who was preparing for SAT. Today, she's in the United States, having made her result excellently.
I currently teach Further Mathematics, which is definitely an upgrade to General Mathematics. Interestingly, some of the topics in the Further Mathematics curriculum are being added to that of General Mathematics.
When I teach, my goal is that my students understand what they are learning. If I have to teach a prerequisite topic, I do, because I really want them to know. Mathematics as a subject requires some level intuition. It's natural. Sometimes, I have to cite practical examples, if necessary, to pass the intended message.
All I require of my potential student is interest in and willingness to know Mathematics.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

While in Primary school, I discovered a procedure for determining multiples of any number between 1 and 10, except 7 (which I had to read about years later). I was already reading Engineering Mathematics by K A Stroud while in JSS3.
I taught an Ireland-based Nigerian girl who was preparing for SAT. Today, she's in the United States, having made her result excellently.
I currently teach Further Mathematics, which is definitely an upgrade to General Mathematics. Interestingly, some of the topics in the Further Mathematics curriculum are being added to that of General Mathematics.
When I teach, my goal is that my students understand what they are learning. If I have to teach a prerequisite topic, I do, because I really want them to know. Mathematics as a subject requires some level intuition. It's natural. Sometimes, I have to cite practical examples, if necessary, to pass the intended message.
All I require of my potential student is interest in and willingness to know Mathematics.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

subject.headline: Mathematics has always been my favourite subject.
subject.description:
The only time I never had a distinction in Mathematics was during my first term in SSS1. That was because I joined the school during the 4th week, but then I still had the highest score. While in Primary school, I discovered a procedure for determining multiples of any number between 1 and 10, except 7 (which I had to read about years later). I was already reading Engineering Mathematics by K A Stroud while in JSS3.
I taught an Ireland-based Nigerian girl who was preparing for SAT. Today, she's in the United States, having made her result excellently.
I currently teach Further Mathematics, which is definitely an upgrade to General Mathematics. Interestingly, some of the topics in the Further Mathematics curriculum are being added to that of General Mathematics.
When I teach, my goal is that my students understand what they are learning. If I have to teach a prerequisite topic, I do, because I really want them to know. Mathematics as a subject requires some level intuition. It's natural. Sometimes, I have to cite practical examples, if necessary, to pass the intended message.
All I require of my potential student is interest in and willingness to know Mathematics.

testimonials.review: I like Fadiji very much, my son loves her too. She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes

response.comment: Thanks so much! Lessons were superb!

testimonials.review: Very stimulating lectures! She explained concepts very well and we were very glad to have selected her as our tutor. We'll continue lessons when school resumes
